title: Understanding Augmentative Alternative Communication
headline: This free online course covers various alternative communication methods for those who are unable to speak effectively.
description: Various disabilities and other reasons can hinder our capacity to communicate conventionally, leading to many frustrations and an inability to participate in daily activities. Augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) is crucial for improving communication control and lowering frustration. In this course, you will learn about the various augmentative alternative communication systems that can assist those with problems communicating.

courseDescription:
This course defines the terms and expectations of intervention in augmentative and alternative communication (AAC). Understanding some of the terminology used in AAC is vital before we delve too far into its intricacies. We'll study its jargon before exploring its many myths.

Did you know that you can consider seven stages of communicative development when assessing a person's current level of communication skills? Learn about these stages of communication growth and the appropriate times to employ augmentative and alternative communication. We will analyze and organize the interconnected pieces that make up an augmentative and alternative communication system.

Speech and language professionals are essential when assessing, diagnosing and treating people who require help with augmentative and alternative communication. We will discuss the purpose of speech and language professionals, the approaches to implementing augmentative and alternative communication, creating practical goals for AAC users and funding for them. We recommend this course for audiologists, speech-language pathologists, assistants or anybody who assists clients with complex communication needs or is interested in this subject matter for personal growth. So sign up and start studying today!
